snippet: The Commerce Department reported that the current account trade deficit grew during the first quarter to its widest imbalance in three years.
abstract: Commerce Department reports the American current account trade deficit rose 15.7 percent in the first quarter to $137.3 billion, up from $118.7 billion in the last-quarter 2011; Labor Dept reports weekly applications for unemployment benefits increased to a seasonally adjusted 386,000 in the previous week; Labor Dept reports the Consumer Price Index fell 0.3 percent in May.
lead_paragraph: The Commerce Department reported that the current account trade deficit grew during the first quarter to its widest imbalance in three years.

headline.seo: Sluggish Job Market and Low Prices Raise Chances of Fed Action
headline.main: Weak Hiring and Low Prices Raise Odds of Fed Action
headline.print_headline: Weak Hiring and Low Prices Raise Odds of Fed Action
